Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ Naamathite (נַעֲמָתִי) ► friend of Job (אִיֹּוב) who comes to comfort but concludes by arguing with Job
= inhabitant of Naamah (נַעֲמָה)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which the mind of humans is filled with distressing thoughts
literally: to bring back; hence: = action by which humans or deities respond to (other) humans or deities in a direct conversation

Node.gloss: for the sake of|for the benefit of|because of
Node.definition: = particle linking proposition X to participant Y, by which Y represents the cause or beneficiary of X

Node.gloss: to be impatient|to be unable to wait
Node.definition: = state in which someone feels a strong urge to perform a particular action, ◄ caused by emotions, ► and resulting in actions

= causative action by which deities offer primarily verbal instruction to humans, which may occasionally be accompanied by physical punishment, given as a result of misbehavior or to prevent misbehavior, ► aimed to teach the receiver (and sometimes other people as well) wisdom and good behavior
= state in which humans experience a feeling of shame, as a result of their own actions or because of what other have done
= inner person of a human or celestial being, associated with emotions, such as joy, grief, worry, courage, anger, willingness, etc.
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= an adverb that specifies unending time

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= state in which humans feel and show great joy
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God
particle linking an event to a point in time; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in time Y
= a very short length of time
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place
= process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day
literally: head; hence: = the topmost part of a vertically oriented object, such as a mountain, and the principal part of an horizontally oriented object, such as a street or a bed
= mass of visible, condensed watery vapor floating in the air; ► producing rain; ≈ God is said to envelop himself with clouds
= process or action by which the hand or another part of the body of humans gets in brief contact with an object, either or not deliberately
= waste matter remaining after food has been digested, discharged from the bowels of humans
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

Node.gloss: to vanish|to disappear|to be lost|to perish|to be broken|to be destroyed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which humans or objects disappear or are removed from existence;◄ either by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, hardship, disaster, natural processes, acts of destruction, or direct divine intervention

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= referent to an unknown location; ► normally used with the purpose of finding which location that is; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that such a location cannot be found
= process by which humans perceive a series of pictures and events in their minds; ≈ often regarded as a revelation from God; sometimes associated with things that disappear in a moment
literally: to fly away; hence: = process by which an object disappears from existence ◄ like a bird that flies away and vanishes from sight
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for

Node.gloss: to drive out|to drive away|to banish|to reject
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans force other humans to leave a certain location
= series of pictures or events in mind of sleeping person; ≈ associated with things that disappear in a moment
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= process by which humans and animals focus their eyes on an object
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= process by which humans perceive, either with their physical eyes or in a vision
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
literally: to bring back (to someone); hence: = causative action by which humans cause other humans to regain possession of something that they used to have in possession before
= material possessions such as gold, silver, animals and slaves; ► usually results in a position of honor and power
literally: bones; hence: = the physical body of a human being
= state or process by which a location is dominated by a certain event, to the extent that it dominates everything else, ◄ as if it were completely filled with that event
= state in which humans are still relatively young; ≈ associated with strength but also with reckless living
= the loose natural substance of the earth's surface

= state or action by which a human being or animal is in or assumes a horizontal position; ► in order to rest, sleep, or have sex with someone, or because of being unable to stand up as a result of weakness or death; ≈ sometimes associated with security
= marker indicating that even if the event in focus is true, another event can take place
= state in which an event is pleasant
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= causative action by which humans refrain from sharing information with others
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

Node.gloss: to be concerned for|to have pity on|to show mercy|to spare
Node.definition: = process by which humans or deities experience an emotion of affection for a particular object or state of event; ► resulting in unwillingness to see that object come to harm or that event to be obstructed
= action by which humans or deities move away from an object, person, or place
= mouth cavity; ◄ part of human body; ► plays an important role in actions like speaking, blowing, kissing, biting, tasting, and chewing
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

literally = the bowels or inner parts of a human body; sometimes used collectively to refer to all the internal organs and even the whole being, and sometimes used to refer to a specific part of the human body, for example, the stomach, the heart, the womb, the soul, the breast, the genitals; ≈ associated with emotions such as anguish but also compassion
= process by which humans, deities, or objects take on a different nature, character, or form

= snake with the ability to spread the ribs in the neck area, so as to form a broad, flat profile called the hood, which makes it look thicker than it really is; reaches two meters in length and 50 millimeters in diameter; it is dark brown with a yellowish underside; very poisonous; feeds on mice, gerbils, birds, bird eggs, lizards, frogs, and other snakes; ≈ associated with great danger
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status
= action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

Node.gloss: to vomit > lose (one's wealth as punishment)
Node.definition: literally: to vomit; hence: = process by which humans lose their possessions in an unpleasant way
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= causative action by which humans or deities take over the ownership of land from other humans, which usually implies that the former owners are driven away
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= poisonous fluid, ◄ produced from poisonous plants or secreted by serpents; ≈ here used to denote suffering and injury

= snake with the ability to spread the ribs in the neck area, so as to form a broad, flat profile called the hood, which makes it look thicker than it really is; reaches two meters in length and 50 millimeters in diameter; it is dark brown with a yellowish underside; very poisonous; feeds on mice, gerbils, birds, bird eggs, lizards, frogs, and other snakes; ≈ associated with great danger
literally: to suck; = action by which humans ingest food
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
exact meaning unknown: = type of viper; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with lurking danger

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= flowing body of water
= a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season
= sweet substance ◄ made either by bees, or from fruits such as dates, grapes or figs; ► much appreciated as food; ≈ associated with abundance and fertility

= coagulated substance; ◄ formed by action of acids on milk; ► made into cheese (חָרִיץ) or eaten as food; ≈ regarded as choice food and therefore often associated with prosperity; because of the smoothness of this substance it is sometimes associated with flattery and untrustworthiness as well

Node.gloss: to take back|to bring back|to return|to put back|to restore (something)
Node.definition: literally: to turn; hence: = causative action by which animals, humans, deities cause (other) animals, humans, or objects to move back to a location where they have been before
= the results of laborious work which requires a lot of energy and ultimately results in exhaustion
= action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death
= objects that people possess in a relatively large quantity; ≈ greatly valued by the owner, strongly coveted by other people, and a cause of status
= action by which animals, humans, or deities suspend their commitment to (other) objects, animals, humans, or deities, either temporarily or permanently
= a person or class of people that lack the means to support themselves; ≈ thereby often despised or mistreated, but being under God's protection

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= action by which humans perform construction activities, either in order to erect a new building or to rebuild or repair an existing one
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= a person who was able to flee from danger

Node.gloss: to eat > to enjoy|to eat > to use up
Node.definition: literally: to eat (goods); hence = pattern of actions by which someone makes a living off material goods until they are gone; ≈ often associated with joy
= process by which a condition lasts for a relatively long time
literally: goodness; = state in which people go through a time of relative prosperity
= state in which an activity is achieved to a full extent
exact meaning unknown; probably: = state in which humans have an abundance of goods and feel secure
= a state in which humans experience extreme anxiety, ◄ as a result of difficult circumstances, as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
literally: hand; hence: = process by which humans or deties engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
= causative action by which someone causes a certain location, container, or surface to be filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects

Node.gloss: to send|to cause to happen|to stir up
Node.definition: literally: to send; hence: = causative action by which deities cause an event to happen
literally: kindling of anger; hence: = process by which the anger (אַף) of deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
literally: to send rain; hence: = causative action by which deities cause objects to fall from the sky ◄ like rain
exact meaning unsure; possibly: = the flesh of the human body, possibly referring more specifically to the bowels or entrails
= action by which humans move to another place in haste, ► in order to escape from a dangerous situation
= class of tools designed to attack and inflict bodily harm on someone else or to defend oneself against similar attacks from other people
= a strong, hard magnetic silvery grey metal, ► used in construction and manufacturing; ≈ associated with strength and permanence
= process by which an object or substance passs through a certain location with strength
= a strong but flexible piece of wood to which a string is attached for the firing of arrows, ► used for hunting or as weapon of war
= a yellowish brown alloy of copper with up to one third tin, ≈ regarded as a hard and difficult to bend

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= the rear part of the human body, especially from the neck to the bottom
= process by which an object reflects light, often because it has been polished
= process by which events take place, ◄ as if they move like objects
= state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or objects to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined, which is often achieved by burying them or by covering them
literally: stored up in a safe place, hence: = person or object considered valuable and/or treated with affection
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

Node.gloss: to be broken|to be crushed|to be ruined
Node.definition: = process by which objects are fractured or smashed
= a person who was able to flee from danger
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= causative action by which a deity or human being causes certain information to become available to someone else
a more or less fixed phrase: the heavens and the earth, equivalent to a single lexical item: the totality of God's creation
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= action by which a group of people leave their country because they are forced to settle somewhere else for an indefinite amount of time
= general term for plants that are sources of food; ≈ a sign of God's blessing

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= something that happens to someone; ◄ whether or not as recompense for what he/she has done
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
